data.title: Andy Murray latest headlines updates - Page 11
data.meta_description: Get the latest Andy Murray news including upcoming tennis tournaments, fixtures and results plus Wimbledon updates.
data.text:
Team GB stars Andy Murray and Dan Evans become 'opponents' on the golf course after their Olympic exit in the men's doubles

Andy Murray is continuing to enjoy his retirement as the tennis legend shared an update of himself playing golf alongside Team GB partner Dan Evans after their Paris Olympics exit.

Retired tennis great Andy Murray reveals plans to renovate his five-star hotel in Scotland after calling time on his sporting career

Sir Andy and his wife Kim continue to seek out improvements at their Cromlix House venue, which is set in acres of secluded Stirlingshire countryside near Dunblane.

SOUL OF SPORT: Team GB have enjoyed a stunning 2024 Paris Olympics, picking up 38 medals, including 10 golds - ANDY HOOPER captures all the drama, emotion and behind-the-scenes stories from the games so far in pictures

It's been a dramatic nine days of action so far in the French capital, with so many inspiring and dramatic storylines taking place, as is always the case with the Olympics.

New snacks please! Sir Andy Murray tucks into sweets and doughnuts just days after bowing out of tennis at Paris Olympics

His glittering career was built on raw talent, a relentless training regime and a strictly controlled diet designed to keep him at the top of his game.

What's Sir Andy going to do now he's retired? Well God knows I need help with the children, says wife Kim

Almost as soon as the tears had dried after his final, emotional professional tennis match last week, speculation began as to what Sir Andy Murray would do next.

Simone Biles draws star-studded crowd at vault finals including John Travolta, Andy Murray and Pharrell

She secured the seventh gold medal of her historic Olympic career in front of a star-studded crown that included actor John Travolta , track star Allyson Felix and musicians Pharrell and Flavor Flav.

How Andy Murray spent the hours after his tennis career ended: British star's doubles partner DAN EVANS reveals what happened next following defeat at Paris Olympics

DAN EVANS: It was a strange feeling in the locker room with Andy Murray on Thursday night. I had a tear in my eye because he's a good friend of mine and it was sad to say goodbye.

Queen's Club honour for Andy Murray after his retirement as LTA hail him as the 'greatest ever British player'

Tennis legend Sir Andy Murray has been immortalised at the scene of some of his greatest triumphs hours after bidding an emotional farewell to his playing days.

Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal pay touching tributes to Andy Murray and hail him for achieving his dream after sporting icon's retirement following his Olympics farewell

Murray gave a tearful, lingering wave to all sides of Court Suzanne Lenglen after he and Dan Evans were beaten in the quarter-finals of the Olympic men's doubles.

Andy Murray admits Olympics defeat gives him 'closure' as Britain's tennis legend brings glittering career to its end - but insists he is happy to leave 'on my own terms'

Andy Murray has opened up on his retirement from tennis as the British sports legend bowed out following Team GB's Olympics men's doubles defeat against USA on Thursday.

Heart-warming moment Team GB athletes form guard of honour for Andy Murray as he returns to Olympic lodgings after final match - as his proud grandparents reveal what they think about his retirement

Andy Murray and tennis partner Dan Evans were defeated by the American pair Taylor Fritz and Tommy Paul in the tennis quarter finals at the Paris Olympics - losing in straight sets.

Kim Sears reveals how husband Andy Murray threw up on court in front of her the first time she watched him play - as mother Judy reveals why she blames Rafael Nadal for his glittering tennis career

The three-time Grand Slam champion cut an emotional figure after he and Dan Evans were knocked out of the men's doubles at the Paris Olympics yesterday evening.

Andy Murray's most beloved (and exhausting!) job: As tennis ace officially retires, how his wife and four children have always been his 'priority' - as he jokes he won't be getting a lie-in any time soon

And as the former World Number One's glowing tennis career comes to an end, it appears to be the perfect time to focus on father duties.

Andy Murray fans left emotional after spotting subtle change to his Twitter bio immediately after retirement following Olympics exit

Many fans have found it difficult to come to terms with Murray's retirement and salt was rubbed further into their wounds when Murray made a subtle yet impactful changed his 'X' bio.

Novak Djokovic's classy tribute to Andy Murray was a fitting way for their rivalry to come to an end, writes IAN HERBERT... the Serb played a small but significant part in the Team GB star's Olympic farewell

IAN HERBERT AT ROLAND GARROS: As the man who had so raged against the dying of the light stood to discuss the curtain falling, the heavens opened.

Centre court at Queen's will be renamed in honour of Andy Murray as the legendary British tennis player's professional career draws to a close after Olympic defeat in Paris

Centre court at Queen's will be renamed in honour of Sir Andy Murray from next year, after his competitive tennis career came to a close with defeat in the Olympic doubles.

Judy Murray pays tribute to her former World No 1 son Andy with heart-warming throwback photo as the three-time Grand Slam winner bids farewell after Olympic exit

Following her son's farewell, Judy took to the social media app X to share a photo of Murray as a five-year-old playing his first match in the sport.

A previously elusive Wimbledon triumph in 2013, one of many improbable comebacks or THAT Sue Barker interview... Mail Sport experts pick out their favourite Andy Murray moments after his retirement

The Brit, who was knighted in 2017, won two Wimbledon titles, one US Open, while he also took gold at the Olympics in 2012 and 2016 in the singles.

Andy Murray posts five-word tweet just minutes after his glittering career comes to an end... as sporting icon also makes a change to his social media bio after his Olympic exit

Sir Andy Murray displayed his signature sense of humour just minutes after his remarkable tennis career came to an end on Thursday night.

Sir Keir Starmer leads tributes to 'true British great' Andy Murray as tennis legend's sensational career comes to a close at the Paris Olympics

The Prime Minister was one of the first to pay tribute to Andy Murray after tonight's match, thanking the tennis player for 'two decades of phenomenal entertainment and sportsmanship'.

Andy Murray claims he's 'glad' to retire from tennis on his 'own terms' after British icon bowed out of Olympics in his final match - as Novak Djokovic hails his long-time rival as a 'warrior'

IAN HERBERT AT ROLAND GARROS: Murray said he was not interested in being a TV commentator and analyst, having not enjoyed the role in the few times he'd tried it.

Dan Evans SOBS as Olympics and Team GB team-mate Andy Murray's career comes to an end after their heartbreaking exit from the men's doubles was confirmed in Paris

Dan Evans was left in floods of tears as his and Andy Murray's Olympic journey was ended by Team USA, with the latter making his final professional appearance in tennis.

BBC presenter Clare Balding breaks down in TEARS live on air as Andy Murray's stunning career comes to an end with Olympic doubles heartbreak in Paris

Murray's career was finally brought to an heartbreaking end in Paris after his men's double exit - and it all appeared to be all too much for BBC presenter Balding.

Andy Murray's glittering career comes to an end: Tearful two-time Wimbledon champion bows out of Olympics after doubles defeat alongside Dan Evans in what is Scot's final ever tennis match

Andy Murray's remarkable tennis career came to an end on Thursday night when he and Team GB partner Dan Evans were beaten by USA duo Taylor Fritz and Tommy Paul in an Olympic quarter-final.

Is this the wildest celebration at the Olympic Games? Danish badminton star bares his chest and wiggles his backside after reaching semi-finals

They will surely be in strong contention to win the top prize for the wildest celebration in Paris after absolutely losing it following their quarter final victory on Thursday.

Emma Raducanu appears to aim subtle dig at Judy Murray, after pulling out of mixed doubles with Andy Murray at Wimbledon - as 21-year-old reaches quarter-finals of the Washington Open

Raducanu cited right wrist soreness as the reason behind her withdrawal but Judy Murray labelled the young Brit's decision to not play as 'astonishing'.

2024 Paris Olympics RECAP: Andy Murray and Dan Evans bow out of the quarter-final stage - while Simone Biles claims GOLD in gymnastics all-round final

Relive Mail Sport's live blog for all the latest news, updates and results from day six of the 2024 Paris Olympics as Tommy Fleetwood and Rory McIlroy tee off in the golf.

Revealed: Dan Evans' 'major sacrifice' that has given British tennis legend Andy Murray the opportunity for an ultimate career swansong at the Paris Olympics

It's been revealed that Team GB's Dan Evans has made a major professional sacrifice, in order to partner with Andy Murray at the Olympics.

Carlos Alcaraz and Rafael Nadal are knocked OUT of the Paris Olympics as dream Spanish pairing fall short in men's tennis doubles against USA

The Spanish pairing had been a duo of the past and present of tennis, with the once-clay King Nadal partnering with the two-time Wimbledon winner 17 years his junior in a bid to make history.

Art-lovers question why painting of controversial pop star Sam Smith naked except for a toga, wearing wings and playing a harp will be displayed in the National Portrait Gallery

Art lovers are baffled at why a painting of controversial pop star Sam Smith as a shirtless angel will be displayed in the National Portrait Gallery.

Fans go wild for radio commentary of Team GB's Olympic swimming relay gold alongside Andy Murray and Dan Evans' triumph in tennis... as they credit BBC Radio 5 Live for 'a masterclass'

Team GB scooped up a fourth gold medal as the men's team retained their 4 x 200m freestyle relay title at a canter. While that was happening, Murray and Evans reached the last eight of the doubles.

Andy Murray and Dan Evans save match points AGAIN to win thrilling tie-break against Belgian pair and reach quarter-finals of men's doubles - extending legendary Scot's career

OLIVER HOLT AT ROLAND GARROS: Something strange is happening here. Perhaps that should really read something predictable, given that Andy Murray is involved.

Andy Murray's rarely-seen father reveals devastating impact split from wife Judy had on his sons and himself

Speaking ahead of what could be his son's last ever tennis match at the Paris Olympics on Tuesday, Andy's father William discussed the effect his divorce had on the tennis star and his brother Jamie.

2024 Paris Olympics RECAP: Andy Murray and Dan Evans seal dramatic win against Belgians as Scot's career goes on, with Team GB picking up swimming and shooting gold

Re-live Mail Sport's live blog for the all the latest news and updates from day four of the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

People see Andy Murray as angry, but this is what he was REALLY like back at the Village after our Olympics epic, writes his doubles partner DAN EVANS

DAN EVANS: Playing with Andy Murray at the Olympics on Sunday was one of the best experiences of my career. It has given us a foothold in the competition, but the match was mad.

Andy Murray's latest act of resurrection is matched only by a handful of other miracles in his career... he keeps on finding a way to show us how unready he is for the end, writes RIATH AL-SAMARRAI

RIATH AL-SAMARRAI AT ROLAND GARROS: Murray told a few of us last week that he was ready for the end. Alongside his list of sporting achievements, we can now add that he is a truly world-class liar.

Andy Murray says there was 'shock and genuine happiness' after pulling off dramatic doubles tie-break comeback to keep retirement at bay at the Paris Olympics

Andy Murray admitted he felt a sense of shock after he and Dan Evans saved five match points to progress to the second round of the doubles at the Paris Olympics.

Andy Murray fans' delight on both sides of the Channel as tennis legend extends his career... just about, as two-time gold medallist clinches nailbiting Olympics comeback at Paris 2024 in arena with plenty of empty seats but Brits leading the cheers

Team GB supporters hailed Murray, who fought off five match points with his partner Dan Evans against Japan's Kei Nishikori and Taro Daniel in the men's doubles on Sunday.

Andy Murray's career goes on - for one more game at least! British star and partner Dan Evans win doubles THRILLER at Paris Olympics after saving five match points

But, as he has done multiple times throughout his glittering career, Murray summoned all of his heart and bravery as they fought back to win the set 7-6 (7-5).

Fans slam 'disgraceful' BBC for not showing Andy Murray's potential career farewell at Paris Olympics on main channel... as viewers criticise 'joke' decision to show rugby sevens instead

Murray, who will retire after the Paris Olympics, is competing in the men's doubles alongside Dan Evans, with the British pair to face Kei Nishikori and Taro Daniel of Japan in the first round.

Dan Evans reveals pledge to Andy Murray left him fearful after suffering injury scare at Paris Olympics

Concerns were raised over Evans' involvement with Murray midway through the match when he suffered a sore wrist and a bloodied knee following a dive shot which required a medical timeout.

2024 Olympic Games RECAP: Adam Peaty BEATEN as he takes silver after Andy Murray wins doubles thriller with Dan Evans and kayak star Kimberley Woods took bronze

Relieve Mail Sport's live blog for the latest scores, results, news and updates from around the Olympics for day three of the Summer Games in Paris.

Today in 60 seconds at the 2024 Olympics - who are Team GB's best hopes for gold on DAY 2 in Paris? And when to watch Andy Murray's possible final match and Simone Biles' return to the Games

DAVID COVERDALE IN PARIS: The Paris 2024 Olympics are now in full flow following a rain-soaked and somewhat chaotic opening ceremony. Team GB got off to a flying start on day one.

Prime Minister and Arsenal fan Sir Keir Starmer tells Laura Woods he'd RATHER Team GB top the Olympics medal table in Paris than the Gunners win the Premier League next season

In an interview with Eurosport and discovery+ presenter Laura Woods, the Prime Minister said: 'You can't do this to me, this is a really really difficult one but I'm going to go for Team GB

Going for gold! Mail Sport writers pick Team GB's top medal hopes for the Paris Olympics and give their favourite memories from past Games

The Paris Olympics are officially underway and Team GB will be hoping to rack up a big collection of medals over the coming weeks.

Andy Murray shares fan's hilarious post that claims tennis star 'will start rusting out in the rain' during Paris Olympics opening ceremony... as British legend gears up for final tournament of his career

Fans have hilariously warned Sir Andy Murray not to stay out in the rain of Paris' Olympic opening ceremony, as they fear he will rust.

Exclusive: Scottish Government to back Judy Murray's Park of Keir plans with £5m funding package

The Scottish Government are backing Judy Murray's community tennis and sports centre at Park of Keir near Dunblane with £5million funding from sportscotland.

Novak Djokovic pays tribute to 'legend' Andy Murray and wishes British star the 'best possible farewell' at the Paris Olympics... before insisting he has no plans to retire despite the fact 'a lot of people would love it'

The Scot announced on Tuesday that he was calling time on a heavily successful career as he arrived in Paris ahead of his fifth Olympic Games.

Paris 2024 full Olympics full interactive schedule: From the men and women's 100m finals to Adam Peaty's shot at history and Andy Murray's last dance

The 2024 Paris Olympics are finally here and there are 18-jam packed days of sport we have to sift our way through. Here at Mail Sport we have identified the important dates for the events you can't miss.

Andy Murray PULLS OUT of the singles as he confirms decision to prioritise doubles with Dan Evans at Paris Olympics in his last-ever tennis tournament

Murray has stated that he has withdrawn from the singles in order to focus on playing doubles with Dan Evans as he still not fully fit after undergoing back surgery last month.

Andy Murray insists he's at peace with his decision to retire and says the Paris Olympics is the best place for his last dance - as he reveals what he will do next

RIATH AL-SAMARRAI IN PARIS: As ever, his journey to contentment has been a battle of wills and a point contested fiercely by his survival instincts on one side of the net and painful truths on the other.

Andy Murray has not spoken to Emma Raducanu since her withdrawal ended his Wimbledon farewell and defends mother Judy's reaction... as the star prepares for Olympics swansong

The former world No 1, who will retire after the Olympics, had intended to sign off on his career at SW19 by playing with Raducanu, only for the 21-year-old to abandon the plan.

Murray's last tango in Paris... how apt for this ultimate team player that his farewell to tennis should be at Olympic Games, writes Hugh MacDonald

The mesmerising dance is nearing an end. The last tango will be in Paris. The Murray retirement saga now has its final scene.

Why Andy Murray is Britain's greatest EVER sportsman: RIATH AL-SAMARRAI on why the Scot is above all the rest

RIATH AL-SAMARRAI: We can choose how we view greatness and how we assess claims across eras and disciplines. But for me it is Murray.

Andy Murray announces retirement, saying Paris Olympics will be the last event he plays in his glittering career

Sir Andy Murray has said the Paris Olympics will be the final event of his stellar career.The two time Wimbledon champ became, who was the first male tennis player to claim

Is this the next Andy Murray? Mother Judy shares picture of Scottish teenage sensation, Charlie Robertson, who has been mentored by her retiring son

As Andy Murray prepares for his retirement from tennis, he has been mentoring perhaps the next big British star in the sport.

Tennis great confirms Olympics will be his 'last ever tournament'

Andy Murray has confirmed that the Paris Olympics will be the 'last-ever tennis tournament' of his illustrious and tenacious career.

Andy Murray confirms Paris Olympics will be his 'LAST ever tennis tournament', with British legend preparing to call time on incredible playing career

Andy Murray has confirmed that the Paris Olympics will be his 'last-ever tennis tournament'. The 37-year-old is calling time on an incredible career which has seen him win three Grand Slams.

Andy Murray and Liam Broady lock horns in hilarious social media exchange as British tennis rivals mock each other over ATP tournament conditions in Atlanta

Broady, the world No 206, is currently taking part in qualifiers for the showpiece but his day got off to the worst possible start, leaving him deeply unimpressed.

Fans joke that the Olympics' official photos look like 'MUGSHOTS' as sports stars including Novak Djokovic, Rory McIlroy and Andy Murray pose awkwardly for passport-style pictures

Novak Djokovic, Carlos Alcaraz, Andy Murray, Rafa Nadal and Iga Swiatek are among the stars to have been photographed, with many fans finding the images hilarious.

Andy Murray's 19-year Wimbledon career: Interactive chart reveals the British star's fastest serve, biggest win, and longest rally at the SW19 tournament - as he says goodbye to professional tennis

MailOnline and Wimbledon's data partner IBM have picked out highlights from Murray's singles career at SW19.

Tennis ace Andy Murray turns down chance to make fortune abroad as he wants to coach children in Scotland

Tennis legend Sir Andy Murray has turned down lucrative offers to open academies abroad so he could instead focus his efforts teaching rising talent in Scotland.

JONATHAN BROCKLEBANK: Is it time for us to rethink the tired old 'anyone but England' routine?

On the day of the General Election last week, a Scotsman stood on England's most famous tennis court and felt the love. It was palpable; overwhelming.

Emma Raducanu enjoys lunch with fellow tennis pro Fran Jones after being branded 'serial choker' by trolls on social media after failing to get through to Wimbledon's second week

The tennis star, 21, and her pal, 23, looked in good spirits as they caught up while dining al fresco.

Judy Murray looks stern as she's seen for the first time at Wimbledon since her apparent swipe at Emma Raducanu for ditching mixed doubles with Andy

Judy Murray, 64, from Scotland, has been spotted at Wimbledon for the first time following her controversial social media message about Emma Raducanu.

Discord in the ranks: Red Hot Chilli Pipers sued by ex-member who accused them of discrimination against his sexual orientation and religion or belief

A group dubbed the 'most famous bagpipe band on the planet' have settled an employment dispute with a former member.

Roy Keane delivers brutal verdict on Andy Murray's Wimbledon farewell - as he claims 'it's NOT sad news' that the British tennis icon is retiring

The two-time Wimbledon champion was hoping to play in the singles at the All England Club this year, but was unable to prove his fitness after spinal cyst surgery last month.

The 'pushy' parents spurring on sporting stars: How Andy Murray, Emma Raducanu, Lewis Hamilton and even David Beckham have been driven to success by their mothers and fathers despite risk of creating 'resentment' from an early age

British F1 legend Lewis Hamilton's father Anthony took on three jobs to help fund his son's training before managing his early career.

AMANDA PLATELL: Shame on you Emma Raducanu for abandoning Andy Murray. I fear she's a one-hit wonder who has lost the support of millions of British tennis fans like me

Can the millions of fans who tuned in to watch Raducanu be forgiven a moment of schadenfreude as the rookie ranked 123 trounced our £10million golden girl?

Wimbledon crowds plummet to their lowest in 26 years as bosses blame the rain for empty seats on courts

Numbers on Friday - the wettest day of the Grand Slam so far - were the lowest seen on day five of the event in more than 25 years.

Andy Murray helped reclaim Wimbledon for Great Britain... he made us feel like we got an invitation to our own party (and we're missing him already), writes OLIVER HOLT

OLIVER HOLT: As he bade an emotional farewell to Wimbledon after his defeat in the men's doubles with brother Jamie last Thursday, many anointed him the greatest British sportsman of all.

Late pull-out Emma Raducanu should have been fully committed to playing with Andy Murray, writes his Olympics partner DAN EVANS

DAN EVANS: Once you agree to play doubles with someone - especially in a special situation like this - then you should be fully committed to it.

The rise (and rise) of padel: How rapidly growing racket sport beloved by David Beckham, Jurgen Klopp and Serena Williams is putting tennis 'at risk' - as padelmania sweeps across Britain

As stars including David Beckham , Jurgen Klopp and even Serena Williams leave tennis in their dust, athletes of all ages are instead flocking to try their hand at padel.

Emma Raducanu offers six-word response to Judy Murray's 'sarcastic' social media post after decision to pull out of mixed doubles and end Andy Murray's Wimbledon career

Raducanu played it safe after waking up with soreness in her wrist, pulling out of her partnership commitment to Murray as she focused on her own singles push.

Novak Djokovic warns how popular game padel is putting tennis in a spin and threatens to take its crown as 'king or queen of racquet sports'

The seven-time Wimbledon champion fears grassroots tennis is 'endangered' as courts are torn down and replaced by those catering to popular offshoots of the sport such as padel and pickleball.

Emma Raducanu's latest injury was dreadfully unfortunate but she was well short of her best against Lulu Sun, writes MATTHEW LAMBERT… it was an unsatisfying end to a highly encouraging tournament

MATTHEW LAMBERT AT CENTRE COURT: A slide, a slip, a tangle of legs and a shake of the head, and Emma Raducanu's Wimbledon campaign was over.
